page.title: 01Rural Steventon and Ashe
page.content: These hamlets and surrounding scattered farms and cottages are situated in a gently rolling agricultural landscape, the underlying chalk covered with clay soil. Farming is mainly arable, Fassets Farm has fresian dairy herd and grazes sheep in winter. Some farms are tenanted, owned by the Prudentil Assurance Comp. Small copses are joined by woodland belts which also border fields and narrow lanes Here pheasant and patridge are reared for winter shooting, wildlife abounds,deer and hare care common In the north the River Test has its source Many residents have occupations connected with agriculture, others commute to surrounding towns, such as Basingstoke or travel by train to London.Local social activities take place in Steventon Parish Hall.
